entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 7.11.25
entry.summary: In a two-segment program, we talk with Terry Brock and Cody Clark about the Sutherlin Stampede, and Javier Caltenco of the U.S. Small Business Administration about their temporary offices in the county to help residents impacted by the March flood event.

entry.title: DFPA MOVES TO IFPL LEVEL 3, PUR REMAINS HIGH, EFFECTIVE MONDAY
entry.summary: July 11, 2025 11:10 a.m. While Public Use Restrictions remain High for residents in the local district, the Douglas Forest Protective Association will increase the Industrial Fire Precaution Level to 3, effective on Monday. DFPA Public Information Officer Rachel Pope said the change applies to all private county, state and Bureau of Indian Affairs lands...

entry.title: Douglas Forest Protective Association Elevates Industrial Fire Precaution Level to 3
entry.summary: Effective July 14, 2025, IFPL will rise to Level 3 in Douglas County. Restrictions apply to industrial operations on public and private forestlands, including limited hours for power-driven machinery. Details at www.dfpa.net or www.blm.gov/orwafire.

entry.title: UMPQUA NATIONAL FOREST IMPLEMENTS PUBLIC USE RESTRICTIONS LEVEL 1

entry.title: Former Douglas County Jail Deputy, Inmate Both Face Charges After Isolation Cell Incident
entry.summary: Former Douglas County corrections deputy Jeremiah Heredia faces assault and misconduct charges after allegedly striking an inmate in an isolation cell. The inmate, who reportedly flicked toilet water at Heredia, is also charged with aggravated harassment.

entry.title: Phoenix School Faces Setback, But Support for Students Remains Strong
entry.summary: Phoenix Charter School’s sponsorship by Roseburg Public Schools has ended, halting its high school program for now. But Phoenix School will continue to provide youth services and support, vowing to help students and families as they navigate their next steps.

entry.title: Fireworks blaze across Roseburg over the Fourth of July weekend
entry.summary: On the Fourth of July, the city of Roseburg came alive with the sights and sounds of the patriotic holiday: crackling fireworks, the boom of mortars, families cheering and laughing at the pyrotechnics.
